issue.title: Finalize design and begin implementation of "Roots"
issue.description: Effort to refactor AMP's internal APIs (e.g. services) to reduce bugs, improve usability, and scale them to future endeavors like AMP "out-of-box" and 1-pass optimization.

issue.title: AMP ID link decoration
issue.description: We intend to implement a link decoration based solution for AMP pages to sync IDs across domains.

issue.title: Leaner AMP
issue.description: Gradually JavaScript payloads for libraries tend to increase in size as features and capabilities are expanded. Occasionally, these increases pass thresholds where devices take a noticeably longer time to parse and evaluate code leading to lower boot up performance.

issue.title: Support IAB Consent Framework using amp-consent
issue.description:
At the moment, consent within amp-consent is binary. Either the user can accept consent for all vendors on the page or reject consent for all vendors on the page. 
This feature provides the ability for a user to accept or reject consent on a per vendor basis. Further, this could also be enhanced to support consent on a per vendor *and* per purpose basis. 
for e.g. a user should be able to give consent at a granular level to Vendor A for the purpose of analytics but reject consent to Vendor A for the purpose of ads. 
Master issue is #15651

issue.title: AMP Google Pay
issue.description: Adds support for integrating Google Pay experiences into AMP pages.

issue.title: One-line PWA
issue.description: Some PWA features are technically simple, but others can be challenging to implement and maintain. This means that a great AMP & PWA site is out of reach for many developers. This feature feature would make it trivially easy to implement an AMP & PWA combination with just one line of code.

issue.title: Support HTML5 ads in AMP Stories
issue.description:
AMP Stories currently supports publishers to deliver direct sold native story ads. This feature captures the work involved for delivering "regular", non-native programmatic and direct sold ads. 
This allows publishers and advertisers to use existing ad demand instead of having to develop natively for stories.

issue.title: Create an onboarding developer portal for ads
issue.description: The feature captures the development of a portal that would help developers understand the tools available to them both for ads being served to AMP pages and non-AMP Pages, including when the ads are legacy ads (ads with JS in them) vs when they are AMPHTML ads.

issue.title: Rewrite the AMP Runtime for ads
issue.description:
When an AMPHTML ad is inside an non-AMP page context, it loads the entire AMP runtime. Although the AMP runtime is performant, it still has a lot of functionality that is irrelevant for rendering an ad. (e.g. scheduling)
This feature captures the effort to rewrite the AMP runtime in a way that's specifically catered for ads and in the process, reduce the ad runtime size to 50% that of the AMP runtime and also decrease ad render time. In addition, this feature will also include additional ad specific library compliance like SafeFrame and MRAID out of the box.

issue.title: Instrument & tweak legacy ad performance with no impact to UX
issue.description: -  Legacy ads (ads that consist of JS) on AMP pages some times have indeterministic behavior in regards to how quickly they appear on screen. This can happen in two different situations: 1) When the AMP page loads and looks entirely loaded by the ads take close to 5-6 seconds to load 2) Ads further down the viewport (even within 5 viewports) are not rendered even when scrolling down 10 seconds after pausing in the first viewport.

issue.title: Public Documentation of AMP for Email
issue.description: This a feature to capture the documentation work necessary to onboard different participants of the email ecosystem.

issue.title: Support video-interface videos in amp-story
issue.description: Right now, the only video player supported is `<amp-video>`; we should also support other video interface players like `<amp-youtube>` or `<amp-dailymotion>`, etc.

issue.title: Make stories respect responsive units
issue.description:
# Problem
Currently, the amp-story desktop UI shows up to three `amp-story-page` elements in view at once:

issue.title: Add new analytics for stories
issue.description:
-  Add an analytics trigger for when the user education overlay is shown (#15420)
-  Add an analytics trigger for when the video spinner is shown

issue.title: Improve video playback reliability for stories
issue.description: See also:

issue.title: Support RTL for amp-story
issue.description: Right now, everything is designed as LTR.  This is a cover bug for enabling RTL support.  We should consider the story to be RTL if:

issue.title: Design/test a new desktop experience for stories
issue.description:
-  Create a prototype of a new desktop experience
-  Test the prototype
-  Integrate feedback
-  Design a launch/rollout plan
-  Roll out the new desktop experience

issue.title: Improve audio UX for amp-story
issue.description: Right now it is unclear which story pages have audio and which do not.  We should improve the audio experience by only showing the audio icon when it makes sense (#13652) and adding callouts as necessary.

issue.title: Support paywalls in amp-story
issue.description: Stories should support paywalls, similar to how standard AMP documents support paywalls through the usage of the `amp-access` component.

issue.title: Allow custom sidebar content in stories
issue.description: We should allow publishers to specify arbitrary custom content to be shown in a sidebar.  The API and documentation should make it clear that every platform has the ability to display or not display this content.  The sidebar can contain both runtime-specified content (configurable by viewer) and publisher-specified content.

issue.title: Increase component support for Stories
issue.description: Currently `<amp-story>` supports few AMP elements as descendants.  We should improve the component support for stories.

issue.title: Allow tapping on elements outside of amp-story-cta-layer
issue.description: For any clickable element outside of amp-story-cta-layer, we should show a tooltip that defers the action until after the user has clicked on the tooltip.

issue.title: Support dynamic & responsive content in amp-carousel
issue.description: Implement two frequently requested improvements to amp-carousel to support dynamic and responsive content.

issue.title: amp-list v2
issue.description: amp-list addressed a number of critical use cases when AMP first launched, but developers have struggled with a set of smaller issues that make the component generally hard to use. This issue is to fix those issues and relaunch under a new name.

issue.title: Ads and video support for amp-lightbox-gallery
issue.description: Follow up on the initial launch for amp-lightbox-gallery with basic support for video and the highly-requested feature of ads support inside the lightbox view

issue.title: Ideation to better support for dynamic content
issue.description: Developers have a range of options in AMP for supporting dynamic data (data that changes based on user-related parameters) when served from a cache: amp-list, amp-geo, amp-bind, etc. However, AMP does not currently offer good support for a number of remaining use cases. This issue tracks the task of identifying additional use cases and brainstorming with core AMP contributors how to better support a broader range of dynamic data in AMP

issue.title: TypeScript in AMP
issue.description: Add TypeScript support to AMP and allow new extensions to be written in TypeScript.

issue.title: Support rendering Sponsored Story Ads within stories
issue.description:
Sponsored Story Ads could be entirely inlined within the organic story instead of having to load the sponsored story in a new tab or with a redirect. 
Full design in the works.

issue.title: Implement support for ad server served ads in AMP Stories
issue.description:
Related to #12381. Background here: https://github.com/ampproject/amphtml/blob/master/extensions/amp-story/amp-story-ads.md
Provide the ability for ad servers to return single page or sponsored story ad from an ad server so that it's spliced in real time into the organic story.

issue.title: Support AMPHTML ads in mobile apps
issue.description: This will require the ads SDK that renders the ad to recognize and deliver the AMPHTML ad to get information like view-ability and getting scroll bound animations to work.

issue.title: Support signed exchanges
issue.description: Vision: https://www.ampproject.org/latest/blog/a-first-look-at-using-web-packaging-to-improve-amp-urls/

issue.title: Improve basic amp-carousel UX
issue.description: Fix some low-hanging fruit for amp-carousel UX, including better visual and interaction design for the slide-advance affordances.

issue.title: amp-video-iframe
issue.description: amp-video increasingly supports engaging and useful video features (analytics, muted autoplay, minimize-on-scroll), and some third-party players have adopted these features through video interface as well. However, single-business custom players can't get these features because they slip through the cracks: implementing them as new components isn't a good approach for AMP since they're not broadly useful to the community, which means they can't use video interface. [amp-video-iframe](https://github.com/ampproject/amphtml/issues/16252) would solve this by making these features available for custom video players via a special wrapper

issue.title: amp-compare-slider
issue.description: Implement a common image-slider pattern for publications comparing two different but related images: celebrities then and now; maps of geographic regions before and after a significant change; documents before and after editing.

issue.title: Improved resizing rules for amp-list
issue.description: This issue captures the work needed to address a number of related amp-list resizing issues.

issue.title: Enhancements to amp-consent
issue.description: This is a master issue to track the second phase of amp-consent which focuses on more advanced use cases of amp-consent. All active features in discussion from the initial amp-consent [implementation] (#13716 ) have been moved to this issue.

issue.title: Substitution variables for amp-consent
issue.description: This feature will enable a publisher to incorporate amp-consent related status information via AMP's substitution variable framework (originally proposed [here](https://github.com/ampproject/amphtml/issues/14916#issuecomment-387766377)).

issue.title: Loading state improvement for default for all components
issue.description: AMP has a default loader for most content that depends on an external server call for content. Currently it's an animated ellipsis for most cases, and a more polished design for ads. This feature is to create a more polished design across all components that need it, and to possibly differentiate designs based on the context.

issue.title: Input masking
issue.description: A common pattern on the web to assist form completion is input masking: automatically inserting expected characters and spaces in a given form input. For instance, "+1 (_ _ _) _ _ _-_ _ _ _" for a phone number in the United States. As the user types, their input fills out the blank entries, and sometimes showing validation issues automatically. This feature is to implement this type of input masking, with a flexible way to implement a system of expected characters and spaces, good default UI for the spaces, ways to easily customize, and a way to integrate with standard form validation.

issue.title: Ads- Launch Real Time Config 2.0
issue.description: Publishers often have the need to enhance an ad request with targeting or audience information. Real Time Config is a publisher configurable end point that's invoked before the ad request to the ad request is made, so the end point and respond with targeting information that is attached along with the ad request.

issue.title: Implement support for publisher served ads in AMP Stories
issue.description: This feature will enable a publisher to hardcode an ad story page inside an AMP Story until more ad servers support delivery of ads for AMP Stories.

issue.title: Land redesign of AMP layout system (Layers)
issue.description: Land the redesign of AMP's layout system to support nested and horizontal scrolling AKA "Layers".

issue.title: Doc-level infinite scroll
issue.description: Support document-level infinite scroll, such that when the user reaches the end of the core content of an AMP document (an article, a product detail page, etc), a call can be made to an arbitrary endpoint to fetch additional documents to be dynamically loaded into the view. For the best user experience, users should never see a loading spinner, but instead should either be presented with already-loaded results, or a "recommended content" section to navigate to more.

issue.title: Element-level infinite scroll
issue.description: Support element-level infinite scroll, such that when the user reaches the end of a list of items (search results, product cards, etc), a call can be made to an arbitrary endpoint to populate the list with more items. For the best user experience, users should never see a loading spinner, but instead should either be presented with already-loaded results, or a button to tap to load more.

issue.title: Minimize video to corner on scroll
issue.description: Often users want to continue watching a video at the same time that they view more content on a web page (see a recipe being made at the same time as jotting down ingredient list or reading steps one by one; watching footage of a news story while reading a deeper dive on the content). This feature is to implement a UI that makes this easy: minimizing videos to the corner of the screen when the user has scrolled them sufficiently out of view. Controls should be available to pause, mute, go to fullscreen, or dismiss the video. Should integrate well with similar platform-level UIs.

issue.title: Trigger video fullscreen in landscape
issue.description: Some browsers offer the capability to automatically trigger video fullscreen in landscape, sometimes at the browser level and sometimes through a developer opt-in. We want this feature to work just as it does per browser (either automatically or via opt-in).

issue.title: Tilt-based animations
issue.description: Developers sometimes link device title to the background position of images, so that the content shifts on the screen in different directions and at different speeds based on the direction and degree of tilt. Ideally we can link this to an intuitive natural metaphor, so it feels predictable and natural. Phase one will be a low-level API along the lines of amp-position-observer, that allows such animations at a basic level.

issue.title: amp-pan-zoom
issue.description: Implement the ability to pan and zoom on interactive content in order to support finely detailed interactive use case (e.g. seat pickers in ticketing transaction flows)

issue.title: Seamless page transitions
issue.description: Users highly value page transitions that preserve as much context and happen as quickly as possible, but standard page navigations refresh the entire page (header bars, menus, etc disappear and reappear again), increasing actual and perceived loading time. App shell patterns (as with progressive web apps) address this opportunity—[this feature](https://github.com/ampproject/amphtml/issues/12981) is to provide a trivially-easy-to-implement way to get similar functionality with minimal effort.

issue.title: Experimental availability of amp-script
issue.description: amp-script is being developed in order to support a much broader set of interactivity in AMP and interoperability with non-AMP libraries & frameworks. This issue tracks the experimental release of amp-script. The viability of amp-script in production is still being investigated

issue.title: Loading state improvements for amp-list
issue.description: amp-list is associated with multiple loading states, particularly when integrated w/ with amp-bind & infinite scroll. Some of these states can already be configured by developers and get a default loading state in order to communicate status to users. This feature is to ensure that more of these states are configurable by developers and get good default states to the extent possible

issue.title: Allow developers to program AMP pages with JavaScript
issue.description: Remove “need to write custom JS for my use case” as top developer pain point.

issue.title: Reimplement viewport implementation as a shadow root
issue.description: https://medium.com/@dvoytenko/amp-ios-scrolling-redo-2-the-shadow-wrapper-approach-experimental-3362ed3c2fa2

issue.title: Support inline CSS
issue.description: When AMP launched, inline CSS was not supported. This limitation meant that it took developers longer to implement pages—this feature entails implementing support inline CSS without sacrificing the performance guarantees of AMP.

issue.title: Productionize and integrate AMP JS validator into runtime
issue.description: (Description pending).

issue.title: Leaner AMP
issue.description:
Goal: Reduce size of AMP’s main JS binary by 50%.
Corollary: Do not regress parse, compile, and execution time of the JS.

issue.title: File upload
issue.description: Until now it has not been possible to upload files from an AMP document. This feature is to support the ability to upload files in AMP with a simple, flexible API with no built-in styling of its own.

issue.title: Date picker
issue.description: Well-designed date pickers are a common requirement for web pages that require users to select a date (e.g. scheduling an appointment, choosing a range of dates as criteria for a flight or hotel search, etc). The range of customizations needed to create good UX across the required use cases is not handled directly or consistently across the web platform, so custom JS is required for most developers—and consequently we needed to build this into AMP!

issue.title: input[type="password"]
issue.description: `<amp-form>` didn't launch with support for `<input type="password">`, due to the initial complexity, but developers have started to ask for this flexibility. This type of input, where the characters are visibly masked as a bullet or asterisk, is used in cases where third parties can directly see the screen of users entering confidential information.

issue.title: amp-consent support in amp-story
issue.description: Bring the feature described in #13716 into amp-story.

issue.title: Easy fly-in-on-scroll
issue.description: amp-position-observer makes it possible to create complex scroll-bound & scroll-triggered animations. However, we want to make some of the most common animations trivially simple to implement. This feature covers the case where arbitrary HTML elements translate slightly across the page in as the user scrolls them into view—both the scroll-bound case and scroll-triggered, time-based case. Developers will be able to configure aspects of the animation like trigger points, timing, and animation curve.

issue.title: Enable user choice using <amp-consent> component
issue.description:
#### Overview ####
A new `<amp-consent>` component that enables publisher to get consents from readers and manage their consents.

issue.title: amp-lightbox-gallery
issue.description: Currently it's possible to link together amp-image-lightbox or amp-lightbox with amp-carousel, to create a seamless immersive experience for viewing media. However, it's labor-intensive to get that right, and there are a number of barriers to really optimizing that experience for users. This feature is to create a trivial-to-implement, full featured immersive experience for viewing media like images and videos. For example, users can tap on an inline image in the page image (or button to trigger the same experience)—the image expands to full screen with a black scrim behind it, and overlayed affordances to exit the view, to view a related caption, to trigger a grid view to access other media in a given group/carousel in the same immersive view, or to hide the overlays to just view the complete media item.

issue.title: Easy fade-in-on-scroll
issue.description: amp-position-observer makes it possible to create complex scroll-bound & scroll-triggered animations. However, we want to make some of the most common animations trivially simple to implement. This feature covers the case where arbitrary HTML elements fade in as the user scrolls them into view—both the scroll-bound case and scroll-triggered, time-based case. Developers will be able to configure aspects of the animation like trigger points, timing, and animation curve.

issue.title: Geo-variation
issue.description: Developers often want to vary content with a small geo-dependent variation, like a sale promotion for a particular locale. This is sometimes possible with components that make a server-side call, like amp-list, but it can be somewhat complex, and doesn't cover all related use-cases well. This feature, amp-geo, will make it easy to vary small sections of web content for users based on an approximation of the users’ country-level location, similar to the level of an ISO Country Code.

issue.title: Easy parallax
issue.description: amp-position-observer makes it possible to create complex scroll-bound & scroll-triggered animations. However, we want to make some of the most common animations trivially simple to implement. This feature covers the case where arbitrary HTML elements move vertically on the page as the user scrolls at a different speed than the rate of scrolling.

issue.title: Intent to Implement: Deprecation of Delayed Fetch for DoubleClick
issue.description: Make Fast Fetch the only means of requesting/rendering ads on AMP Pages using DoubleClick `<amp-ad>` tags. Fully deprecate the Delayed Fetch request/rendering path for DoubleClick `<amp-ad>` tags.

issue.title: Write 2018 development plan for AMP runtime
issue.description: (Description pending).
